title: Question 5
prompt: When sunlight hits an object, it may be absorbed and changed to heat energy, or it may be reflected off the object. On a sunny day, Jack is walking barefoot down the street. He finds that the black asphalt is too hot to walk on, but the white sidewalk is cooler. Which of the following best explains why the sidewalk is cooler?
description: Click the <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback:
The passage says that light can be absorbed and changed to heat, so absorbed light creates heat. Reflected light is not absorbed, and does not create heat. A cooler surface reflects more light and absorbs less light.



When sunlight hits an object, it may be absorbed and changed to heat energy, or it may be reflected off the object. On a sunny day, Jack is walking barefoot down the street. He finds that the black asphalt is too hot to walk on, but the white sidewalk is cooler.
